item.title: Hiding menu when clicking outside - AngularJS
item.description: Assume you have a menu which looks like the following: <div class="right-menu" ng-click="toggleMenu($event);"> <img src="img/RightMenuIcon.png" alt="" /> </div> <div ng-show="menuOpened" class="menu-dropdown-right"> <ul> <li ng-hide="loggedIn" class="class"><a href="#/authenticate">Login</a> </li> <li ng-show="loggedIn" ng-click="logOut()"><a href="#">Logout</a> </li> </ul> </div> When the div gets a click event, angular calls toggleMenu which toggles the menuOpened variable. Changing the value of this variable in turn makes the div show/hide. To hide the menu when clicking outside of the div, we add a onclick handler to window object which checks the menuOpened variable and updates it if the menu is visible.
